title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
00:39 <Denis> has quit  
00:57 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:58 <sburjan`> has quit  
00:58 <sburjan\_> is now known as <sburjan`>  
02:39 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
02:44 <Denis> has quit  
04:39 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <Denis> has quit  
07:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:11 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:12 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <sburjan`> has quit  
08:31 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <msmeria> has quit  
09:04 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <sburjan> vmassol: good morning. I'm starting to work on the test cases re-organization to make it 1-to-1 as you said.  
09:28 <sburjan> do you also recommend renaming the spaces as the corresponding maven module ?  
09:43 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
09:47 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <vmassol> sburjan: you can name them with the new directory names that we've voted for supporting shorter path names  
10:18 <sburjan> vmassol: ok  
10:22 <sburjan> vmassol: shouldn't we move https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/src/test/it/org/xwiki/test/ui/xe/DocumentIndexAttachmentsTabFilterTest.java to platform next to other tests ?  
10:23 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <vmassol> sburjan: the goal is to have 0 functional tests in XE  
10:26 <vmassol> actually the goal is to remove the xwiki-enterprise repo  
10:26 <sburjan> vmassol: exactly  
10:26 <vmassol> I've been creating new modules and moving tests  
10:26 <vmassol> but there's a lot of work  
10:27 <sburjan> I was proposing to move this test from enterprise to platform, near the other existing tests of document-index  
10:27 <vmassol> makes sense  
10:28 <sburjan> because ATM this is test is feeling lonely in enterprise and his brothers are in platform in the correct module :)  
10:29 <vmassol> it should probably be moved inside AllDocsTest  
10:30 <vmassol> sburjan: you want to create a PR?  
10:31 <sburjan> vmassol: i could, but not now because I am busy with the test organization.  
10:31 <vmassol> ok  
10:31 <vmassol> np  
10:31 <vmassol> I'll move it  
10:34 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
11:13 <sburjan> @devs: which is the jira component for Distribution Wizard ?  
11:15 <vmassol> sburjan: EM  
11:15 <sburjan> thanks vincent  
11:28 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <msmeria> has quit  
11:31 <msmeria1> has quit  
11:32 <tmortagne> sburjan: for now it's still EM until it's generic and extensible enough to have it's own module  
11:33 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <sburjan> has quit  
12:05 <altker1281> has quit  
12:34 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
12:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
12:44 <vmassol> has quit  
12:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:53 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:01 <msmeria> has quit  
13:03 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:05 <evalica> has quit  
13:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
13:06 <msmeria> has quit  
13:11 <mflorea> has quit  
13:11 <altker1281> has joined #xwiki  
13:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
13:19 <vmassol> sburjan: done, wasn't as easy as it seemed ;)  
13:51 <Denis> has quit  
14:00 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:01 <vmassol> has quit  
14:01 <msmeria> has quit  
14:08 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
14:09 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:13 <sburjan> vmassol: means it's good you did it. I'm soure I couldn't do it :P  
14:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: you forgot to commit on master I think  
14:29 <tmortagne> vmassol: if you are talking about save comment I know but I'm going to merge in not too long  
14:29 <vmassol> ok  
14:29 <cjd> has quit  
14:30 <vmassol> wow impressive # of failures on http://ci.xwiki.org/  
14:33 <vmassol> fixing platform build  
14:39 <vmassol> ok platform shoud be ok now  
14:39 <vmassol> now there are just 30 jobs more failing  
14:39 <vmassol> :(  
14:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: this one should be for you: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-5.0.x/57/console  
14:40 <vmassol> hm seems the 5.x ones are caused by the version update  
14:40 <vmassol> 5.0.x I mean  
14:41 <tmortagne> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-5.0.x/57/console is because platform did not built everything properly  
14:41 <sburjan> vmassol: could you tell me where is the code for the export page ? (html, pdf, html, xar)  
14:42 <vmassol> tmortagne: wdym? platform 5.0.x has built fine apparently  
14:43 <vmassol> sburjan: ExportAction in oldcore  
14:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's currently building  
14:44 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, but in which space should I put these tests ? in xwiki-platform-oldcore ? (working on hierarchy)  
14:44 <vmassol> yes oldcore  
14:44 <vmassol> as I said yesterday you can have subcategories if you wish  
14:44 <vmassol> (while waiting for new modules to be created in the future)  
14:45 <vmassol> e.g. oldcore-export  
14:45 <sburjan> yes but we don't support nested spaces, so I can'd build a hierarchy  
14:45 <vmassol> not sure at all  
14:45 <vmassol> \*true  
14:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: XE simply built before platform was done, we need to wait for platform build ending to start XE again  
14:45 <vmassol> you don't need nested spaces to build a hiearchy  
14:45 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok got it  
14:46 <tmortagne> always the same when changing the versions despite the jenkins configration we have that is supposed to deal with that  
14:46 <sburjan> vmassol, imagine that I have a directory with several pages (xml pages which model the tests) .. how can I create a hierarchy of dirs ad still be able to import them in the wiki ?  
14:46 <vmassol> nothing that jenkins can do  
14:47 <vmassol> the only solution is to commit in the right order and wait  
14:47 <vmassol> (wait before each push)  
14:47 <vmassol> commons first, wait, rendering, wait, etc  
14:47 <vmassol> painful  
14:47 <tmortagne> it has been committed in the right order and jenkins do have a configuration we used to wait when a dependency is building  
14:48 <vmassol> that's not hte problem  
14:48 <vmassol> the problem is that if you commit in platform then platform will trigger  
14:48 <vmassol> the repos are separate it's separate commits  
14:48 <tmortagne> and the platform commit was pushed before the XE one  
14:49 <vmassol> yes but why should jenkins wait?  
14:49 <vmassol> there's no reason  
14:49 <vmassol> it doesn't know the 2 commits are linked  
14:49 <vmassol> s/doesn't/cannot  
14:49 <tmortagne> because we configured jenkins job to wait when one of them dependecy is building  
14:49 <tmortagne> he know that XE depends on platform  
14:49 <vmassol> yes but that's wrong  
14:49 <tmortagne> we don't care about the comits  
14:49 <vmassol> if you commit in commons  
14:49 <vmassol> and then I commit in platofrm something unlreated  
14:49 <vmassol> \*unrelated  
14:50 <vmassol> platform should build right away  
14:50 <vmassol> in any case I don't know what wait time they have  
14:50 <tmortagne> vmassol: I'm not telling you what's wrong and right and reminding you the setup we used...  
14:50 <tmortagne> and which is still supposed to be in place  
14:50 <vmassol> we don't really control when github will ping jenkins  
14:51 <vmassol> maybe it pinged first xe before platform  
14:51 <vmassol> I'm not sure about the setting you mention though, would need to recheck it  
14:52 <tmortagne> looks like someone removed that setup from XE  
14:52 <tmortagne> platform still have it  
14:52 <tmortagne> which is why it did not failed and waited for commons  
14:52 <vmassol> ok that explains it  
14:53 <tmortagne> "Block build when upstream project is building"  
14:53 <vmassol> ok  
14:54 <vmassol> it has good and bads but I agree the pros are probaby better than the cons for us ATM  
14:54 <vmassol> are you putting it back on XE?  
14:54 <tmortagne> done  
14:56 <vmassol> note: I've disabled the cvs plugin for jenkins  
14:58 <sburjan> vmassol: any idea where is the Edit Page code ? Edit Wiki, Edit WYSIWYG, Edit Object, Edit Class, Edit Inline  
15:01 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:02 <vmassol> from  a ui pov it's platform-web, the action code is in oldcore  
15:03 <sburjan> vmassol: yes, but I don't know exactly in which category to put them. because they are basically ui-tests which exercise code from oldcore  
15:03 <vmassol> platform-web for me  
15:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:03 <vmassol> this is where I would write the functional tests  
15:04 <sburjan> ok, thanks. I'm gonna continue to annoy you with questions like these :)  
15:05 <vmassol> you don't really need to do that  
15:06 <sburjan> vmassol: in this manner I guess that almost all of the top menul (Copy Page, Rename Page, Delete Page,  Delete Space) are in platform-web  
15:06 <vmassol> you could have a single XE category for stuff that are in XE, oldcore, web  
15:06 <vmassol> the important thing is to match the exsiting paltform modules that are not oldcore/web  
15:07 <vmassol> for the other ones the tests have not been moved to platform anyway  
15:07 <vmassol> so you're asking question that have no answer ATM really  
15:07 <sburjan> yes, those which are not in platform-core or platform-web are easy because they have their module :)  
15:07 <sburjan> like blog, app within minutes, workspaces, document index, etc  
15:09 <sburjan> this is why I am doing this now, because it will be hard to keep synched the structure from the app with the structure from the codebase  
15:16 <sburjan> vmassol, any idea where the wiki editor code is ?  
15:17 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
16:06 <msmeria> has quit  
16:29 <vmassol> grrr I broke http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform%20Quality%20Checks/466/console  
16:36 <vmassol> fixed  
16:39 <vmassol> tmortagne: you just merged the solr indexing thread in platform right? :)  
16:39 <tmortagne> vmassol: yes  
16:39 <vmassol> cool  
16:39 <vmassol> does it mean we can start testing it?  
16:39 <tmortagne> It's a bit young but yes  
16:40 <tmortagne> there is still XWIKI-9200 missing so by default you don't have anything in the solr index in the jetty/hsqldb for example  
16:40 <tmortagne> but modifications are indexed now  
16:40 <tmortagne> also upgrade to solr/lucene 4.3  
16:41 <tmortagne> and did a lot of cleaning/refactoring to improve performences so it's prossible I broke some thing  
16:41 <tmortagne> I still need to improve test coverage  
16:42 <vmassol> what's your plan re lucene vs solr? Will we have both indexes at the same time so that we can compare results?  
16:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: right now the issue is that things like search suggest are still tied to lucene index  
16:43 <tmortagne> don't know if I will have time to refactor it in a more generic way  
16:43 <tmortagne> for this I need to introduce Result API to query API I think to be really clean  
16:44 <tmortagne> (SOLR search worked through Query API)  
16:44 <tmortagne> works  
16:44 <tmortagne> but Query API only return plain list of object which is way too simple IMO for advanced use cases  
16:45 <vmassol> yes it is  
16:45 <tmortagne> I have to go, bb in 1 or 2 h more or less (father duties)  
16:45 <vmassol> we need query manager to be able to return references too for example  
16:46 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:16 <sburjan> vmassol: I see that in the tests you moved today, you removed the test prefix for the test methods. Are we dropping the convention of naming test methods ?  
17:16 <vmassol> this was dropped… 4 years ago ;)  
17:16 <sburjan> when we switched to JUnit 4 ?  
17:17 <vmassol> no  
17:17 <vmassol> before  
17:17 <vmassol> when we started using @Test  
17:17 <vmassol> actually maybe it was junit 4, don't remember  
17:17 <sburjan> yes, afaik the@Test annotation is the new thing in JUnit 4  
17:17 <sburjan> (one of the new things)  
17:18 <vmassol> Some best practices:  
17:18 <vmassol> ? Name the Test class with the name of the class under test suffixed with Test. For example the JUnit test class for XWikiMessageTool should be named XWikiMessageToolTest  
17:18 <vmassol> from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing  
17:19 <sburjan> ok, then you recommend I also remove the test prefix from my Test Reporting App ?  
17:20 <sburjan> actually I won't because they are mapped to the java tests, so it's better to keep the same name  
17:20 <vmassol> yes  
17:20 <sburjan> yes to which of them ? :)  
17:23 <sburjan> (vmassol)  
17:24 <vmassol> to the last one  
17:37 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
17:50 <vmassol> chalx: hi  
17:51 <vmassol> could be nice to have nice attachment names :)  
17:51 <vmassol> "Alexandru Chelariu (RecruitmentApp.Alexandru Chelariu) - XWiki.png" doesn't look like a very nice name to me :)  
17:51 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
17:52 <vmassol> a name representing what the image is about would be nice  
17:52 <vmassol> wdyt?  
17:52 <vmassol> also your screenshot are too arge  
17:52 <vmassol> large  
17:52 <vmassol> we have some rules for xwiki.org  
17:52 <vmassol> let me find them  
17:53 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide  
17:53 <vmassol> specifically: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DocGuide#HScreenshots2FImages  
17:54 <chalx> hi  
18:00 <vmassol> chalx: so wdyt?  
18:00 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:10 <vmassol> chalx: have you resized teh images?  
18:10 <vmassol> they look blurred  
18:10 <vmassol> you shouldn't resize  
18:10 <vmassol> instead you need to change your browser viewport size  
18:10 <vmassol> before taking the snapshot  
18:11 <chalx> vmassol, whit a image program  
18:11 <vmassol> wdym by whit?  
18:11 <chalx> vmassol, with sorry  
18:11 <vmassol> I mean  
18:11 <vmassol> what do you mean?  
18:11 <vmassol> "with an image program" is not full sentence  
18:12 <vmassol> I don't understand what it means :)  
18:12 <vmassol> I asked a question  
18:12 <vmassol> "chalx: have you resized teh images?"  
18:12 <vmassol> and you answer:  
18:12 <vmassol> "with an image program"  
18:12 <vmassol> that doesn't compute for me  
18:12 <chalx> vmassol, my mistake, yes I resized them  
18:12 <vmassol> ok then you should't do that  
18:13 <vmassol> because as you can see the images are blurred now  
18:13 <vmassol> you need to take full size screenshot but with a smaller viewport instead  
18:14 <chalx> vmassol, ok  
18:15 <vmassol> another strategy is to remove not important parts of the image if it doesn't fit  
18:16 <vmassol> your last image for example  
18:16 <vmassol> has about 50% of white space  
18:16 <vmassol> which isn't really useful to see....  
18:16 <vmassol> (chalx)  
18:17 <chalx> vmassol, ok I am working on it  
18:17 <chalx> has quit  
18:18 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
18:25 <chalx> vmassol, I changed the images  
18:25 <vmassol> chalx: cool :)  
18:26 <vmassol> much nicer now!  
18:26 <chalx> thx  
18:26 <vmassol> chalx: never use full urls too  
18:27 <vmassol> when referencing pages in the wiki  
18:27 <vmassol> otherwise when we rename pages they links won't be renamed  
18:27 <chalx> vmassol, I change them now  
18:32 <chalx> vmassol, done  
18:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems there's a pb on e.x.o for authors  
18:34 <vmassol> for ex: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Extension/Recruitment+application  
18:34 <vmassol> I get: "com.xpn.xwiki.objects.ListProperty$NotifyList@7a4ed0d1"  
18:40 <chalx> has quit  
18:44 <evalica> has quit  
19:08 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
19:11 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
19:26 <sburjan> has quit  
19:26 <vmassol> sdumitriu or anyone: do you know if there's a way to write a query to list all pages having xobjects  of a given name  
19:26 <vmassol> ?  
19:27 <mflorea> has quit  
19:28 <vmassol> (ideally with the query manager)  
19:29 <vmassol> actually it should be easy  
19:36 <tmortagne> vmassol: my "name" you mean class name ?  
19:36 <vmassol> yes  
19:36 <vmassol> the class name is displayed  
19:36 <tmortagne> that's a pretty common use case in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Query+Module  
19:37 <vmassol> tmortagne: no, that's not what I mean re xwql  
19:37 <vmassol> the object name is passed as parameter  
19:37 <vmassol> I need to find if we can query the BaseObject table  
19:37 <tmortagne> so the answer to my question was no :)  
19:37 <tmortagne> you don't want the class name  
19:38 <vmassol> that's not really user friendly ;)  
19:38 <vmassol> gtg, bbl  
19:38 <tmortagne> you can query any table AFAIK with xwql  
19:39 <tmortagne> it will just pass through  
19:40 <tdelafosse> has quit
